emailTemplate.subject: Login from a new location
emailTemplate.body:
Hello,

We noticed a login to your {APP_NAME} account from a new location:

{ALERT_INFO}

If this wasn't you, you should immediately change your {APP_NAME} account password to revoke access from all other locations.

If this was you, you may disregard this email.

Thanks,
{APP_NAME} team

emailTemplate.subject: OTP for {APP_NAME}
emailTemplate.body:
Hello,

Your one-time password is: {OTP}

If you didn't ask for the one-time password, you can ignore this email.

Thanks,
{APP_NAME} team

verificationTemplate.subject: Verify your {APP_NAME} email
verificationTemplate.body:
Hello,

Thank you for joining us at {APP_NAME}.

Click on the button below to verify your email address.

Verify

Thanks,
{APP_NAME} team

resetPasswordTemplate.subject: Reset your {APP_NAME} password
resetPasswordTemplate.body:
Hello,

Using a password manager is essential for maintaining strong, unique passwords across all your accounts. Many people rely on short passwords or passwords made up of common words, but these are highly vulnerable to attacks like brute force and dictionary attacks. Hackers use automated tools to guess weak passwords in seconds, making it crucial to use long, random, and complex passwords.

Reusing passwords is also a major security risk—if one account is compromised, all other accounts using the same password are at risk. A password manager helps generate and store unique passwords for each account, ensuring better security without the need to remember them all.

KeePassXC is an excellent choice for managing passwords securely. Unlike cloud-based services like LastPass—which has suffered multiple security breaches—KeePassXC stores your passwords locally, giving you full control over your data and how to synchronize it to your devices. Because it does not rely on external providers, your passwords remain safe from large-scale hacks or data leaks. With strong encryption and open-source transparency, KeePassXC is a reliable tool for protecting your online accounts.

Click on the button below to reset your password.

Reset password

If you didn't ask to reset your password, you can ignore this email.

Thanks,
{APP_NAME} team

confirmEmailChangeTemplate.subject: Confirm your {APP_NAME} new email address
confirmEmailChangeTemplate.body:
Hello,

Click on the button below to confirm your new email address.

Confirm new email

If you didn't ask to change your email address, you can ignore this email.

Thanks,
{APP_NAME} team

name: _authOrigins
indexes: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX `idx_authOrigins_unique_pairs` ON `_authOrigins` (collectionRef, recordRef, fingerprint)

name: _externalAuths
indexes: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX `idx_externalAuths_record_provider` ON `_externalAuths` (collectionRef, recordRef, provider)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX `idx_externalAuths_collection_provider` ON `_externalAuths` (collectionRef, provider, providerId)

listRule: @request.auth.id != "" // If you know what you're doing you can easily request all picks here. But If I restrict this to the current user, the subscription events are blocked...
viewRule:
@request.auth.id != "" &&
@request.auth.id = user // Can only view your own picks in this collection - otherwise use "visibleracepicks" collection
name: racepicks

listRule: @request.auth.id != "" // If you know what you're doing you can easily request all picks here. But If I restrict this to the current user, the subscription events are blocked...
viewRule:
@request.auth.id != "" &&
@request.auth.id = user // Can only view your own picks in this collection - otherwise use "visibleseasonpicks" collection
name: seasonpicks
currentpickedusers
viewQuery:
-- This query returns users with an extra field "picked", depending on if they made their picks for the next race yet
SELECT
    user.id, user.username, user.firstname, user.avatar, user.admin,
    -- Generate the additional field "picked" that contains the current picks ID if the user occurs in the picks for the current race and NULL otherwise
    (CASE
        WHEN rp.user IS NOT NULL THEN rp.id
        ELSE NULL
    END) AS picked
FROM
    users user
-- Join users and racepicks where the race matches the current race id (user ids that are missing from this join will receive picked=false)
LEFT JOIN
    racepicks rp ON user.id = rp.user AND rp.race IN (SELECT id FROM currentrace)
ORDER BY user.id ASC;

name: currentrace
viewQuery:
-- This query will select the first race that doesn't have a related result (ordered by race step)
SELECT race.id, race.name, race.step, race.pictogram, race.pxx, race.sprintqualidate, race.sprintdate, race.qualidate, race.racedate
FROM races race

-- Join the races to the raceresults (keeps all races rows)
LEFT JOIN raceresults raceresult ON race.id = raceresult.race

-- Choose entries that don't have a raceresult
WHERE raceresult.race IS NULL

-- Order by race step
ORDER BY race.step ASC

-- Only choose the first entry
LIMIT 1;

name: hottakes
viewQuery:
SELECT sp.id, sp.user, sp.hottake
FROM seasonpicks sp;

name: racepickpoints
viewQuery:
SELECT
    rp.id,
    rp.user,
    -- rp.race,
    r.step,
  
    -- rp.pxx,
    -- rr.pxxs,
    (CASE
        -- Correct pxx pick
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[3]') THEN 10
  
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[2]') THEN 6
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[4]') THEN 6
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[1]') THEN 3
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[5]') THEN 3
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[0]') THEN 1
        WHEN rp.pxx = JSON_EXTRACT(rr.pxxs, '$[6]') THEN 1
  
        ELSE 0 
    END) AS pxx_points,
  
    -- rp.dnf,
    -- rr.dnfs,
    (CASE
        -- Correct dnf pick with a single DNF
        -- WHEN rr.dnfs LIKE '["' || rp.dnf || '"]' THEN 10
  
        -- Correct dnf pick with single or multiple DNFs
        WHEN rr.dnfs LIKE '[%"' || rp.dnf || '"%]' THEN 10
  
        ELSE 0 
    END) AS dnf_points
FROM racepicks rp
JOIN races r ON rp.race = r.id
JOIN raceresults rr ON rp.race = rr.race
-- WHERE pxx_points > 0 OR dnf_points > 0
ORDER BY r.step ASC;

name: racepickpointsacc
viewQuery:
SELECT
    p.id,
    p.user,
    p.step,
    (SUM(p.pxx_points) OVER(PARTITION BY p.user ORDER BY p.step ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)) AS acc_pxx_points,
    (SUM(p.dnf_points) OVER(PARTITION BY p.user ORDER BY p.step ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)) AS acc_dnf_points,
    (SUM(p.pxx_points + p.dnf_points) OVER(PARTITION BY p.user ORDER BY p.step ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)) AS acc_points
FROM racepickpoints p
ORDER BY step ASC;

name: racepickpointstotal
viewQuery:
SELECT
    p.id,
    p.user,
    SUM(p.pxx_points) AS total_pxx_points,
    SUM(p.dnf_points) AS total_dnf_points,
    SUM(p.pxx_points + p.dnf_points) AS total_points,
    (CAST(SUM(p.pxx_points + p.dnf_points) AS REAL) / COUNT(*)) AS total_points_per_pick
FROM racepickpoints p
GROUP BY user
ORDER BY total_points DESC;

name: raceresultsdesc
viewQuery:
-- This query simply returns the raceresults sorted by their race steps (descending).
SELECT result.id, result.race, result.pxxs, result.dnfs
FROM raceresults result
JOIN races race ON result.race = race.id
ORDER BY race.step DESC;

name: scraped_raceresultsacc
viewQuery:
SELECT
    r.id,
    r.race_step,
    r.driver_code,
    (SUM(r.points) OVER(PARTITION BY r.driver_code ORDER BY r.race_step ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW)) AS acc_points
FROM scraped_raceresults r
ORDER BY race_step ASC;

name: seasonpickedusers
viewQuery:
-- This query returns users with an extra field "picked", depending on if they made their season picks yet
SELECT
    user.id, user.username, user.firstname, user.avatar, user.admin,
    -- Generate the additional field "picked" that contains the season pick ID if the user occurs in the seasonpicks and false otherwise
    (CASE
        WHEN sp.user IS NOT NULL THEN sp.id
        ELSE NULL
    END) AS picked
FROM
    users user
-- Join users and seasonpicks (user ids that are missing from this join will receive picked=false)
LEFT JOIN
    seasonpicks sp ON user.id = sp.user
ORDER BY user.id ASC;

name: visibleracepicks
viewQuery:
-- This query returns all racepicks except the ones for the currentrace
SELECT pick.id, pick.user, pick.race, pick.pxx, pick.dnf
FROM racepicks pick
WHERE pick.race NOT IN (SELECT cr.id FROM currentrace cr);

name: visibleseasonpicks
viewQuery:
-- This query only returns the season picks if the first race has started
SELECT pick.id, pick.user, pick.hottake, pick.wdcwinner, pick.wccwinner, pick.mostovertakes, pick.mostdnfs, pick.doohanstarts, pick.teamwinners, pick.podiums
FROM seasonpicks pick
WHERE DATETIME('now') >= (SELECT MIN(qualidate) FROM races);

name: visibleseasonpickslength
viewQuery:
-- This is used inside the seasonpicks API filters
SELECT
  (ROW_NUMBER() OVER()) as id,
  COUNT("*") as total
FROM visibleseasonpicks
